decoder

Interface Decoder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DecoderImpl

    public interface Decoder
    This interface represent a Decoder interface. Decoding is common operations on data. Given encoded data(string), decoder will transfer it back to its original message. A decoder could add code by given symbol and its code, could decode from given encoded string to its original string, could represent all decode codes, and could show whether this decode tree is complete.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCode(char symbol, java.lang.String code)
      This method could add a symbol and its code to code tree and return nothing.
      java.lang.String allCodes()
      This method will return all the symbols and codes in code tree added by addCode.
      java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String msg)
      This method will take a encoded text as string and return its original message according to symbol and code from addCode method.
      boolean isCodeComplete()
      This method will return true if code tree is complete, or false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • addCode

        void addCode(char symbol,
             java.lang.String code)
      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method could add a symbol and its code to code tree and return nothing. A symbol could have different codes, but one code has only one symbol. If symbol is '\0', or code is null or empty string, or this code has another symbol to decode, or this code is prefix of another code, or this code contains symbol not in code symbol set, this method will throw IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        symbol - the symbol to add, a char
        code - the code of symbol, a string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - throws if symbol or code is illegal

      • decode

        java.lang.String decode(java.lang.String msg)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method will take a encoded text as string and return its original message according to symbol and code from addCode method. If input is null or empty string, or input string contain characters not in code symbol set or input string cannot be decoded because the code is not in code tree, this method will throw IllegalStateException.
        Parameters:
        msg - input string to decode
        Returns:
        original message of input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - throws if msg is null or empty string, or contain illegal characters, or cnnot be decoded

      • allCodes

        java.lang.String allCodes()
        This method will return all the symbols and codes in code tree added by addCode. For each line, if symbol is x and code is yyy, then this line will be x:yyy, with a '\n' in the end of line if this line is not the last line.
        Returns:
        all the symbols and codes in code tree.

      • isCodeComplete

        boolean isCodeComplete()
        This method will return true if code tree is complete, or false otherwise. A code is said to be complete if every valid encoded message can be successfully decoded. If the decoding is done by using a coding tree, then this condition is fulfilled if the coding tree is full (i.e. every non-leaf node has exactly the same number of children, equal to the number of coding symbols).
        Returns:
        true if code tree is complete, or false otherwise
